org.openmuc.jrxtx

Interface SerialPort

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.io.Closeable

    public interface SerialPort
extends java.io.Closeable
    Serial port for communication using UARTs. Can be used for communication protocols such as RS-232 and RS-485.

    A SerialPort is created using SerialPortBuilder. Once closed it cannot be opened again but has to be recreated.

      • getInputStream

        java.io.InputStream getInputStream()
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the input stream for this serial port.

        Closing the returned InputStream will close the associated serial port.

        Returns:
        the InputStream object that can be used to read from the port.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurred

        Also closes the associated input and output streams.

      • getSerialPortTimeout

        int getSerialPortTimeout()
        Returns setting for serial port timeout. 0 returns implies that the option is disabled (i.e., timeout of infinity).
        Returns:
        the serialPortTimeout.
        See Also:
        setSerialPortTimeout(int)

      • setSerialPortTimeout

        void setSerialPortTimeout(int serialPortTimeout)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Enable/disable serial port timeout with the specified timeout, in milliseconds. With this option set to a non-zero timeout, a read() call on the InputStream associated with this serial port will block for only this amount of time. If the timeout expires, a org.openmuc.jrxtx.SerialPortTimeoutExcepption is raised, though the serial port is still valid. The option must be enabled prior to entering the blocking operation to have effect. The timeout must be > 0. A timeout of zero is interpreted as an infinite timeout.
        Parameters:
        serialPortTimeout - the specified timeout, in milliseconds.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is an error in the underlying protocol.
        See Also:
        getSerialPortTimeout()

      • setFlowControl

        void setFlowControl(FlowControl flowControl)
             throws java.io.IOException
